message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Agriculture continues to be an important sector for economic growth and poverty reduction, and this study uses data from the World Bank's Living Standard Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA) to examine the relationship between agricultural intensification and household welfare in Mozambique.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Living Standard Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This research analyzes the impact of climate change on droughts by using a gridded dataset of precipitation and temperature.", "dataset": ["gridded dataset of precipitation and temperature"], "topic": ["Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "The study employs a comprehensive dataset which covers 35 countries and provides detailed information on macroeconomic indicators such as productivity, prices, investments, and trade.", "dataset": ["comprehensive dataset"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "This paper examines how natural resource wealth and governance affect public debt sustainability using a panel dataset covering 55 resource-rich countries.", "dataset": ["panel dataset covering 55 resource-rich countries"], "topic": ["Debt", "Governance", "Extractive Industries"]}, {"sentence": "Drawing on transaction-level data from the Central Bank of Nigeria and secondary data sources, we explore the effect of mobile money services on financial inclusion in rural areas of Nigeria.", "dataset": ["transaction-level data from the Central Bank of Nigeria"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "To measure the impact of extractive industries on local communities, we employ two unique datasets: one containing detailed information on mining concessions, and another containing household-level survey data.", "dataset": ["two unique datasets", "household-level survey data", "mining concessions"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "In this study on the effects of road infrastructure improvements on exports, we use data on trade flows between Cote d’Ivoire, Burkina Faso, and Mali from 2010-2017.", "dataset": ["data on trade flows between Cote d’Ivoire, Burkina Faso, and Mali"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "This research examines how different dimensions of governance contribute to economic diversification in Sub-Saharan Africa and employs data from the World Bank's Worldwide Governance Indicators and the United Nations' Comtrade database.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Worldwide Governance Indicators", "United Nations' Comtrade database"], "topic": ["Governance", "Regional Integration"]}, {"sentence": "Using household survey data and remotely sensed data, this paper investigates the relationship between deforestation and food security in Brazil’s Legal Amazon.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "remotely sensed data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This project explores whether cash transfers can alleviate poverty in developing countries by analyzing data from randomized controlled trials conducted in seven African countries.", "dataset": ["data from randomized controlled trials conducted in seven African countries"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "We use a combination of satellite-based fire detection data and land cover maps to examine the drivers of forest fires in Indonesia over the past two decades.", "dataset": ["satellite-based fire detection data", "land cover maps"], "topic": ["Environment"]}]
